collectionDetail.name: Caffeine Fix
collectionDetail.introduction: A perfect blend of coffee spots in the city!

experiences.introduction: APT Coffee is where you can grab a toast and cup of coffee that are tailored to your tastes. For your caffeine fix, choose the bean flavours, brew intensity, milk or water volume, and foam level.
experiences.name: APT Coffee

experiences.introduction: Who says you can’t get a caffeine fix at a bar? Bound by Hillywood is where you can do so while surrounded by the chill, artsy vibes of the interior design. Visit it today in Prince Edward!
experiences.name: Bound by Hillywood

experiences.introduction: Head over to Cafe Life to complete your caffeine fix for the day! Serving tasty coffee and nice desserts, Café Life has a lovely staff that will surely keep you coming back for more.
experiences.name: Cafe Life

experiences.introduction: Sit back and treat yourself with a caffeine fix at Coco Espresso. If you’re into creamy lattes, Coco brews them, too! The cafe also offers cold brews.
experiences.name: Coco Espresso

experiences.introduction: If you happen to pass by Mee Lun Street, get your caffeine fix at Elixir. Its signature cold-brew osmanthus-infused tonic is a must-try with an excellent symphony of bittersweet flavours.
experiences.name: Elixir

experiences.introduction: Start your week by getting your caffeine fix at Kaffeine. Located at 108 Jervois Street, Sheung Wan, this cafe also offers breakfast, lunch, and brunch dishes.
experiences.name: Kaffeine

experiences.introduction: If you’re looking for a place in Yau Ma Tei to get your caffeine fix while reading a book, head over to Kubrick. The cafe brews coffee that is rich and creamy — perfect for whiling away time.
experiences.name: Kubrick

experiences.introduction: Want some twist with your daily caffeine fix? Head over to Rest Coffee Gin and indulge in its specialty alcoholic coffee drinks. Check out the food menu and find several dishes to go with your drinks.
experiences.name: Rest Coffee Gin

experiences.introduction: A caffeine fix at Starting Over Espresso can give you a dose of positive energy to help you seize the day. This cafe also offers single-origin coffee beans from Indonesia, Ethiopia, and Colombia.
experiences.name: Starting Over Espresso

experiences.introduction: Get your caffeine fix and booze in one at Winstons Coffee. Espresso Martini, its house signature, is worth a try. It’s a mixture of Black Cow vodka, Mr. Black, espresso, and chocolate bitters.
experiences.name: Winstons Coffee - Sai Ying Pun

experiences.introduction: This is one of the best speakeasy cocktail bars in town. As one of the OGs in Hong Kong, its decadent, dimly lit and rusticly leather bound decor serves as the perfect backdrop to their elegantly crafted cocktails. If you're looking for an intimate setting that doubles up as an encyclopedia of drinks, look no further than Stockton.
experiences.name: Caprice

experiences.introduction: Recognised as the best bar in Asia 2021, and one of the top bars in the World, COA is a second home for those who savour meticulously curated Mexican-inspired tequila and mezcal cockails. Their signature 'La Paloma de Oaxaca' and 'Coconut Milk Punch' come highly recommended from the njihu team!
experiences.name: COA

experiences.introduction: Small but mighty! Little L.A.B is known for its innovative cocktails that bring a touch of local flavours to the scene. They'll customise a drink to fit your needs and desires. So, head over to the L.A.B for a little cocktail therapy!
experiences.name: Little L.A.B

experiences.introduction: Awarded as Asia's most sustainable bar in 2021, Penicillin supports the local economy, as it runs Hong Kong’s first closed-loop bar programme where ingredients are locally sourced and drinks and food are upcycled! Treat yourself to the future.
experiences.name: Penicillin

experiences.introduction: In collaboration with New York's Iconic cocktail bar 'PDT (Please Don't Tell), PDT Hong Kong is a bar within a bar. Expect intimacy and nothing but stellar cocktails. Just remember - mum's the word.
experiences.name: Please Don't Tell (PDT)

experiences.introduction: The Quinary is a self-proclaimed multisensorial cocktail bar aimed at satiating all your senses. If that isn't enough, their concotion of cocktails will certainly tickle your tastebuds and leave you wanting more. Our sixth-sense is telling us that this one's a winner.
experiences.name: Quinary

experiences.introduction: Here's the tea... hidden away in the heart of central is one of the most unique craft cocktail bars in the city. The wonderful folks at Tell Camellia have mastered the art of infusing our palattes with tea inspired cocktails. This isn't your usual cuppa, but we're here for it!
experiences.name: Tell Camellia

experiences.introduction: Transport yourself to the lush tropics of Havana, as you sip on rum based cocktails at The Daily Tot. Get there early to secure a spot, because this joint is incredbly popular - njihu approved, and for good reason too!
experiences.name: The Daily Tot

experiences.introduction: Knock knock. Check-in for a 5-star speak-easy exerpeince where creativity, curioisty and charm are the defining characteristics of the cocktails served up at Room 309. This one's a gem!
experiences.name: Room 309

experiences.introduction: A top choice for after-work drinks, where an effortlessly chic ambience meets classic American mixology. Our favourite drinks include the English House Punch and the Tarling!
experiences.name: The Diplomat

collectionDetail.name: Happy Hour!
collectionDetail.introduction: Our favourite Happy Hour spots in town!

experiences.introduction: 50% off selected beer, cocktails and win, with complimentary antipasti. Happy Hour! from 3pm - 7pm daily.
experiences.name: 208 Duecento Otto

experiences.introduction: Armoury is a great spot for post work drinks with plenty of outdoor seating. Enjoy $50 cocktails every single day from 3pm - 8pm.
experiences.name: Armoury

experiences.introduction: Get bubbly with $38 glasses of wine and prosecco. Happy Hour! from 3pm - 8pm daily.
experiences.name: Ask for Alonzo

experiences.introduction: Buy one, get one free on selected wines, beers and cocktails between 4pm-7pm daily.
experiences.name: Bizou

experiences.introduction: This Peel Street staple does $40 beers and wine from 3pm-10pm Monday to Saturday. It doesn't get cheaper than this - except for the 7/11 down the road ;)
experiences.name: Chi Chi Cham

experiences.introduction: Free-flow beer, wings and fries for $108. This is definitely one of the craziest deals we've seen in Soho. Weekdays from 5pm-7pm.
experiences.name: Finis

experiences.introduction: One of our favourites, this gem in Sai Ying Pun does $40 wines, spirits and cocktails from 3pm-7pm on weekdays and 4pm-6pm on weekends.
experiences.name: Flying Pig

experiences.introduction: $25 drinks evey day from 4pm-7pm. Ocean views complimentary. Need we say more?
experiences.name: Hemingways

experiences.introduction: Ichu offers some mean Peruvian food alongside $50 house spirits and cocktails. Happy Hour! from 3pm-6pm on weekdays only.
experiences.name: Ichu Terraza

experiences.introduction: Looking for a loooong happy hour with good food? Mr. Wolf does beers, wines, and cocktails from $45 onwards from 3pm to 9pm every day. Insider tip: Don't miss their chicken tikka
experiences.name: Mr Wolf

experiences.introduction: A classy Spanish-style gin bar, Optimist does selected wines, beers and spirits for $48 every day from 3pm - 7.30pm.
experiences.name: Optimist

experiences.introduction: Free flow wine? We hear you. $350 pp for 2 hours, 12pm-7pm Monday through Saturday.
experiences.name: PIIN Wine Restaurant

experiences.introduction: Enjoy drinks at half price every day from 3pm-6pm
experiences.name: Scarlett Cafe and Wine Bar

experiences.introduction: Don't look further if you plan to start drinking early. Buy one, get one free on beers and wines and special prices on cocktails. Every day from 12pm-9pm.
experiences.name: Tai Lung Fung

experiences.introduction: Fancy some tacos and tequila in TST? Check out TJ's for $40 margaritas and beers every day from 3pm-9pm.
experiences.name: Tequila Jack's

experiences.introduction: Some of the best cocktails in town with super friendly bartenders. $50 cocktails every day from 6pm-9pm.
experiences.name: Varga Lounge

collectionDetail.name: It's Wine O'clock!
collectionDetail.introduction: Time to wine down, sip back, and relax.

experiences.name: LQV CENTRAL - Le Bar & La Cave

experiences.introduction: Dr. Fern's Gin Parlour is a great hideaway after a long day. The bar creates custom cocktails for everyone which you can enjoy with bar bites such as mixed cheese boards and charcuterie.
experiences.name: Dr. Fern's Gin Parlour

experiences.introduction: In collaboration with New York's Iconic cocktail bar 'PDT (Please Don't Tell), PDT Hong Kong is a bar within a bar. Expect intimacy and nothing but stellar cocktails. Just remember - mum's the word.
experiences.name: Please Don't Tell (PDT)

experiences.introduction: The Wilshire is one of the best speakeasies to visit that’s located within the Mexican restaurant 11 Westside. Tell the bartenders your drink preferences and they’ll shake up your custom cocktail.
experiences.name: The Wilshire

experiences.introduction: Fancy the rare bourbon Pappy van Winkle? Try to catch it at 001. Hidden in a black door, this speakeasy is concealed behind Graham Street’s market stalls. Just find that doorbell and dim spotlight.
A bar within a bar, Frank’s Library is the perfect place to enjoy premium cocktails that are inspired by fictional Frank Minza’s adventures. This speakeasy has a 1950s-style interior.
experiences.name: Frank's Library

experiences.introduction: The Poet is a secret drinking spot to enjoy house signature twists. Its Crimson Tide is scrumptiously spicy with a salty hint of nori from its gin base. Try also the lime-infused bourbon mix It Girl!
experiences.name: The Poet

experiences.introduction: If whisky is your drink of choice, go to Mizunara, a speakeasy where you’ll be greeted with more than 800 whisky bottles from Irish, Japanese, American, and Scottish distilleries. Try its cocktails!
experiences.name: Mizunara

experiences.introduction: Knock knock. Check-in for a 5-star speak-easy exerpeince where creativity, curioisty and charm are the defining characteristics of the cocktails served up at Room 309. This one's a gem!
experiences.name: Room 309

experiences.introduction: If you’re looking for a sophisticated speakeasy spot that caters to women only, go to XX at Rosewood Hong Kong. Enjoy bite-sized snacks and light cocktails here with your lady friendships!
experiences.name: XX

experiences.introduction: Foxglove proves that the best places are hidden in plain sight. This speakeasy presents itself as an umbrella shop on Duddell Street. Go towards the back of the boutique and find the entrance there.
experiences.name: Foxglove

experiences.introduction: If you’re into whisky, choose from Nocturne’s three sets of unique whisky tasting options. This Japanese-inspired speakeasy features dim lights and soft jazz for a more mysterious appeal.
experiences.name: Nocturne

experiences.introduction: A whisky lover’s dream, Butler is a Japanese-inspired speakeasy that features an extensive cocktail and whisky menu. Watch the experts create your bespoke drink that’s based on your preferences.
experiences.name: Butler

experiences.introduction: A top choice for after-work drinks, where an effortlessly chic ambience meets classic American mixology. Our favourite drinks include the English House Punch and the Tarling!
experiences.name: The Diplomat

collectionDetail.name: Cheers to Beers!
collectionDetail.introduction: Tap in to HKG’s top local breweries!

experiences.introduction: Also known as Ho Lan Jeng (which means "very f*ing tasty" in Cantonese). 65 Peel moved from Peel Street to the 2nd floor of LKF 29, dragon and phoenix artwork preserves the original local feel. Amazing selection of local craft beers, to go with their solid sharing menu, makes this a good place to meet up with friends or a date.
experiences.name: 65 Peel

experiences.introduction: Hidden in a quiet street behind the Man Mo Temple is this casual bottle shop, with a few outdoor seats spread around the vicinity. The collection of largely imported beers includes American as well as Belgian crafts. While the atmosphere around the place is generally laid-back, larger groups can be found sitting around on weekend nights.
experiences.name: Craftissimo

experiences.introduction: This beer place in Wan Chai serves largely local drafts, with a few outdoor seats facing Johnston road
experiences.name: Hoppy Junction

experiences.introduction: Tiny yet awe-inspiring record store that serves as a gathering place for the HK rock scene. The fridge is filled with locally crafted lagers, which you can drink with the owner while listening to everything from jazz to hip hop to metal
experiences.name: InFree Records

experiences.introduction: The brewery is based in an industrial building, and opens to public only on weekends. For 250HKD you can tap all you want from 5-7 Moonzen kegs for 4 hours. Sit at big tables and play old-school video games. Recommended to call in advance to confirm availability.
experiences.name: Moonzen Brewery

experiences.introduction: Looking for a gastropub serving fresh pours from Heroes or Young Master? Second Draft is the place to go. With 20 draft beers offered, this spacious bar is a fun retreat for snacks or dinner.
experiences.name: Second Draft
TAP The Ale Project - Tsuen Wan

experiences.introduction: Homebase of the Yardley Brothers on Lamma island, where they started their brewery.
experiences.name: The Beer Shack

experiences.introduction: This spacious gastropub has been a craft beer institution for years, with 15-20 draft taps and an extensive list of bottles. It’s not just drinks - the famous pies and other enhanced pub foods are worth a try. Happy hour prices until 8pm. Tutored beer tastings for groups of 4 or more.
experiences.name: The Globe

experiences.introduction: Hidden in a quiet street behind the Man Mo Temple is this casual bottle shop, with a few outdoor seats spread around the vicinity. The collection of largely imported beers includes American as well as Belgian crafts. While the atmosphere around the place is generally laid-back, larger groups can be found sitting around on weekend nights.
experiences.name: Craftissimo

experiences.name: APT Coffee
